translations.text: Alif. Lam. Mim.
These are the verses of the Wise Book,<sup foot_note="180250">1</sup>
a guidance and mercy for the doers of good,<sup foot_note="180251">1</sup>
who establish Prayer and pay Zakah, and have firm faith in the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="180252">1</sup>
It is they who are on true guidance from their Lord, and it is they who shall prosper.<sup foot_note="180253">1</sup>

There are some human beings<sup foot_note="180254">1</sup> who purchase an enchanting diversion<sup foot_note="180255">2</sup> in order to lead people away from the way of Allah without having any knowledge,<sup foot_note="180256">3</sup> who hold the call to the Way of Allah to ridicule.<sup foot_note="180257">4</sup> A humiliating chastisement awaits them.<sup foot_note="180258">5</sup>

When Our verses are recited to such a person, he arrogantly turns away, as though he had not heard them, or as though there was a deafness in his ears. So announce to him the tidings of a grievous chastisement.
Surely those who believe and do good deeds shall have Gardens of Bliss.<sup foot_note="180259">1</sup>
They shall abide in them forever. This is Allah's promise that shall come true. He is the Most Powerful, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="180260">1</sup>

He<sup foot_note="180261">1</sup> created the heavens without any pillars visible to you<sup foot_note="180262">2</sup> and He placed mountains in the earth as pegs lest it should turn topsy turvy with you,<sup foot_note="180263">3</sup> and He dispersed all kinds of animals over the earth, and sent down water from the sky causing all kinds of excellent plants to grow on it.

Such is Allah's creation. Show me, then, what any others, apart from Allah, have created.<sup foot_note="180264">1</sup> Nay, the fact is that the wrong-doers are in manifest error.<sup foot_note="180265">2</sup>

We<sup foot_note="180266">1</sup> bestowed wisdom upon Luqman, (enjoining): “Give thanks to Allah.”<sup foot_note="180267">2</sup> Whoso gives thanks to Allah, does so to his own good. And whoso disbelieves (let him know that) Allah is All-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="180268">3</sup>

And call to mind when Luqman said to his son while exhorting him: “My son, do not associate others with Allah in His Divinity.<sup foot_note="180269">1</sup> Surely, associating others with Allah in His Divinity is a mighty wrong.”<sup foot_note="180270">2</sup>

We<sup foot_note="180271">1</sup> enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years.<sup foot_note="180272">2</sup> (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): “Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.

But if they press you to associate others with Me in My Divinity, (to associate) those regarding whom you have no knowledge<sup foot_note="180273">1</sup> (that they are My associates), do not obey them. And yet treat them well in this world, and follow the way of him who turns to Me in devotion. Eventually it is to Me that all of you shall return,<sup foot_note="180274">2</sup> and I shall then tell you all that you did.”<sup foot_note="180275">3</sup>

(Luqman said):<sup foot_note="180276">1</sup> “Son, Allah will bring forth<sup foot_note="180277">2</sup> everything even if it be as small as the grain of a mustard seed even though it be hidden inside a rock or (anywhere) in the heavens or earth. Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware.

Son, establish Prayer, enjoin all that is good and forbid all that is evil, and endure with patience whatever affliction befalls you.<sup foot_note="180278">1</sup> Surely these have been emphatically enjoined.<sup foot_note="180279">2</sup>

Do not (contemptuously) turn your face away from people,<sup foot_note="180280">1</sup> nor tread haughtily upon earth. Allah does not love the arrogant and the vainglorious.<sup foot_note="180281">2</sup>
Be moderate in your stride<sup foot_note="180282">1</sup> and lower your voice. Verily the most disgusting of all voices is the braying of the donkey.”<sup foot_note="180283">2</sup>

Have you not seen that Allah has subjected to your service all that is in the heavens<sup foot_note="180284">1</sup> and on the earth and has abundantly bestowed upon you all His bounties, both visible and invisible?<sup foot_note="180285">2</sup> Yet some persons dispute regarding Allah<sup foot_note="180286">3</sup> without having any knowledge or guidance or any illuminating Book.<sup foot_note="180287">4</sup>

When they are told: “Follow what Allah has revealed,” they say: “We will rather follow that which we have found our forefathers following.” (Will they follow that) even though Satan might invite them to the chastisement of the Blazing Fire?<sup foot_note="180288">1</sup>

Whoever surrenders himself to Allah<sup foot_note="180289">1</sup> and lives righteously<sup foot_note="180290">2</sup> grasps the most firm handle.<sup foot_note="180291">3</sup> The ultimate decision of all matters rests with Allah.

So let the unbelief of the unbeliever not grieve you.<sup foot_note="180292">1</sup> To Us is their return and then We shall inform them of all that they did. Surely Allah knows well even the secrets that are hidden in the breasts (of people).
We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

If you were to ask them: “Who created the heavens and the earth?” they will certainly reply: “Allah.” Say: “All praise and thanks be to Allah.”<sup foot_note="180293">1</sup> Yet most of them do not know.<sup foot_note="180294">2</sup>
All that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah.<sup foot_note="180295">1</sup> Verily He is All-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="180296">2</sup>

If all the trees on earth become pens, and the sea replenished by seven more seas were to supply them with ink, the Words of Allah would not be exhausted.<sup foot_note="180297">1</sup>Verily Allah is Most Mighty, Most Wise.
To create all of you or to resurrect all of you is to Him like (creating or resurrecting) a single person. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.<sup foot_note="180298">1</sup>

Do you not see that Allah makes the night phase into the day and makes the day phase into the night and has subjected the sun and the moon<sup foot_note="180299">1</sup> to His will so that each of them is pursuing its course till an appointed time? (Do you not know that)<sup foot_note="180300">2</sup> Allah is well aware of all that you do?

All this is because Allah, He alone, is the Truth<sup foot_note="180301">1</sup> and all that which they call upon beside Him is false.<sup foot_note="180302">2</sup> Surely Allah, He alone, is All-High, Incomparably Great.<sup foot_note="180303">3</sup>

Do you not see that ships sail in the sea by Allah's Grace that He may show you some of His Signs?<sup foot_note="180304">1</sup> Surely there are Signs in this for everyone who is steadfast, thankful.<sup foot_note="180305">2</sup>

When waves engulf them (in the sea) like canopies, they call upon Allah, consecrating their faith solely to Him. But when He delivers them safely to the land, some of them become lukewarm.<sup foot_note="180306">1</sup> None denies Our Signs except the perfidious, the ungrateful.<sup foot_note="180307">2</sup>

O people, fear (the wrath) of your Lord, and dread the Day when no father will stand for his child, nor any child stand for his father.<sup foot_note="180308">1</sup> Surely Allah's promise is true.<sup foot_note="180309">2</sup> So let the life of this world not beguile you,<sup foot_note="180310">3</sup> nor let the Deluder delude you about Allah.<sup foot_note="180311">4</sup>

Surely Allah alone has the knowledge of the Hour. It is He Who sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs, although no person knows what he will earn tomorrow, nor does he know in which land he will die. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.
